result.execSummary:
The defendant Adler J. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Follow conditions as stated in Deferred agreement, if complies may be dismissed

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 4 days if revoked.
Probation will commence after jail sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA sample already given.
Counseling as deemed necessary.
Domestic Abuse Counseling.
Parenting Classes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid during extended supervison.

AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation. 
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.
Counseling deemed by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls 15-CF-213, 18-CF-38 and 17-CF-237 @ 9:02 am.  Defendant Adler J. Hill in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Adler J. Hill in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives plea agreement, 15CF213 SAR, 17CF237 DRI, 18CF38 ct 1 plea, ct 2 plea, ct 3 DRI, 18CF38 ct 1 4 years prison, 24 months initial confinement & 24 extended supervision,  costs, DNA Sample and surcharge, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation,  Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed by agent, ct 2 4 year prison,  24 months initial confinement, 24 extended supervision, costs and same conditions.  15CF213 State has reviewed revocation and summary packet and no corrections.  3 years prison, 18 months 18 months concurrent with 18CF38 and comply with conditions in 18CF38.  Atty Abenethy- Mays and def. agrees with plea agreement.  Atty Abernethy-Mays has reviewed revocation and summary packet and no corrections. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties.  18CF38 Mnf/Deliver Amphetamine, Conspiracy, Second, no contest plea. ct 2 Bail jumping Felony, no contest plea. Court will grants State motion to DRI in ct 3 18CF38 and 17CF237. Def. advised of Constitutional rights.  Def. understands elements.  Def. admits prior conviction. Atty Abernethy-Mays is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely and voluntarily given. Factual basis. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1  Mnf/Deliver Amphetamine, Conspiracy, Second and Bailjumping in Ct 2. State gives sentencing recommendations.  15CF213 302 days credit, 18CF38 289 days credit. Atty Abernethy-Mays gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. makes statement.  Court orders on 15-CF-213  Ct 1 3 years prison, 18 months initial confinement and 18 months extended supervision, Credit 304 days.  AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation,  Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed by agent. Costs to paid during extended supervision. 
18CF38 ct 1 4 years prison, 24 months initial confinement & 24 extended supervision, costs, DNA Sample and $250 surcharge, Same conditions 15CF213,  ct 2 4 year prison,  24 months initial confinement, 24 extended supervision, costs, $250 DNA surcharge and same conditions as 15CF213. Sentence concurrent with 15CF38. Credit for 289 days. Def. is eligible for Challenge and Substance Programs. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

records.addlTxt: 17A 008013-Balance of Bond from 16-CF-220 applied to this case

Defendant Adler J. Hill in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Adler J. Hill in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF211, 15CF213 and 16CF220.   15CF211 is set for sentencing after revocation.  15CF213 def entered plea.  16CF220  DRI Ct 1 and plea to Ct 2.  Probation 2 yrs to run concurrent.  Conditions stated by Atty Constable.  Recess 2:15 pm  Reconvene 2:29 pm  All parties present.  DA has reviewed revocation packet.  State will go along with agents recommendations.  Atty Abernethy-Mays will argue sentence.  Joint agreement on 15CF213 & 16CF220.  Court will proceed on these cases.  Plea advisement form completed and reviewed.  16CF220 - Ct 2 - No contest plea entered.  Ct 1 DRI consistent with plea agreement.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Plea entered freely & voluntarily.  Complaints reviewed, factual basis.  Court finds def. understand charges, penalties and rights.  Plea accepted.  Found guilty Ct2 16CF220. 15CF213 Ct 1.  Revocation packet received and reviewed.  No corrections.  State presents sentencing arguments.  15CF211 State is requesting 9 months jail, consecutive.   Credit of 133 days.  16CF220 & 15CF213 2 years probation concurrent, consecutive to 15CF211.   Victim rights have been complied with for all cases.  Atty Abernethy-Mays presents arguments for sentencing.  Requesting 6 months jail on 15CF211.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  Court will accept plea agreement on 15CF213 & 16CF220.  15CF213 Sentence withheld 2 yr probation.  Cost  Plus DNA surcharge.  Sample already given.  Counseling as deemed necessary.  Domestic abuse counseling.  Parenting classes.  16CF220 sentence withheld probation 2 yrs on Ct 2  same conditions.  Cost & DNA surcharge.    16CF220 - 7 days credit  & 15CF213 4 days credit if revoked.  15CF211 Court orders jail sentence will be consecutive.  Probation will commence after jail sentence.  Orders 8 months jail, credit 133 days.  Outstanding court obligations converted to civil judgment.  Huber privileges.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post convictions rights  Felony conviction rights reviewed.  Bond to be applied to 16CF220 1st then 15CF213.  Huber according to jail policies.

Court calls  @ 3:03 pm. Attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF211, 16CF220 also set for plea & sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Adler J. Hill in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement to adjourn this matter and proceed with   16CF220  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Time limits waived for preliminary.  Timely preliminary explained to def.   Def waives time limits.  Court will accept waiver of time.  15CF213 will follow.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Adler J. Hill in court, via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF213 & 16CF220 called.  15CF213 motion to revoke deferred entry of judgment.  Def has applied for court appointed atty.  Court reviews form for court appointed atty.  Court will not appoint an atty.  Def will hire counsel.  Def requesting time to obtain counsel.  both cases will adjourned  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment

Defendant Adler J. Hill in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF211 and 15CF213 @ 2:10 p.m. Agreement stated - 15CF211 - amended information filed, Def will plead to ct 1, dismiss and read in ct 2. Ct 1 - withheld sentence, 2yrs probation, AODA and follow through, sex offender assessment and follow through, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  15CF213 - amended information filed, Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss w/prejudice, ct 1 - defer judgment 2 yrs, written agreement prepared. State has complied with victim notification requirements. Atty Schuster agrees. Def agrees. Court reviews plea quest. 15CF211 Court grants amendment to ct 1 and in 15CF213 ct 1. 15CF211 ct 1 - no contest plea. 15CF213 ct 1 - no contest plea. 15CF211 ct 2 dismissed and read in. 15CF213 ct 2 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF211 ct 1 as amended and 15CF213 ct 1 as amended. Counsel heard on sentencing and deferred judgment agreement. Atty Schuster advises 7 days sentence credit and asks bond be returned to poster, will provide updated address to the Court. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will follow agreement. 15CF211 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, sex offender assessment and follow through, court costs, DNA surcharge, return bond to poster at updated address, credit for 7 days if revoked.  15CF213 - court approves deferred judgment agreement for 2 yrs. $500 signature bond.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 15CF211 - DNA sample. Postconviction rights.  8/9/18 @ 1:00 p.m. review hearing on 15CF213.
